description: Team capability assessment involves evaluating the skills, processes, and practices of a software development team to determine their effectiveness and readiness for projects. This assessment helps organizations make informed decisions about team assignments, training needs, and process improvements.
you_have_this_if: You are considering awarding a contract to a software development team.
You want to implement DevOps practices within your organization.
You are looking to improve project outcomes through better evaluations of team capabilities.
You need to identify gaps in team skills and processes.
You are preparing for a project that requires specific team competencies.

approaches.technique: Capability Maturity Model Integration (CMMI) with DevOps practices
approaches.best_for: When you need a structured framework to assess and improve team capabilities in a DevOps context.
approaches.key_tradeoff: Provides a comprehensive assessment but may require significant time and resources to implement.

decision_matrix.best_when: You need a thorough evaluation of team capabilities before starting a new project or initiative.

start_here: The recommended first approach is to use the Capability Maturity Model Integration (CMMI) with DevOps practices, as it provides a structured framework for assessing team capabilities and aligning them with project goals.
